intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana subsp. montana, commonly known as the mountain eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at higher elevations. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces numerous small flowers clustered in the axils of the leaves. This subspecies is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
